title: Octopus Energy to provide renewable energy to Ebico in new white-label partnership
lead: ​Octopus Energy has announced a white-label partnership with Ebico, providing renewable electricity for its customers.
author: Alice Grundy

title: Temasek and BlackRock announce $1bn decarbonisation fund
lead: ​Investment company Temasek has partnered with BlackRock to invest in next-generation net zero solutions, such as renewable energy technologies.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: UK ranks 5th in Wärtsilä’s COVID-19 Europe emissions scorecard
lead: ​The UK has come in 5th position in a ranking of the drop in emissions seen across Europe since the start of national COVID-19 lockdowns.
author: Alice Grundy

title: PODCAST: The role of long-duration energy storage for grids and solar’s global curtailment risk
lead: This month’s episode of the Solar Media Podcast, sponsored by Honeywell, is out now, featuring discussion on long-duration energy storage, grid stability and how solar is at risk of prolonged curtailment in Vietnam.
author: Current± Staff

title: Current± launches new webinar series with P375 discussion with Elexon
lead: ​Current± is pleased to launch a brand new series of webinars, focusing in on the key drivers of the energy transition in Britain.

title: EDF to sell its only UK CCGT plant West Burton B to EIG
lead: ​EDF has announced the sale of its only gas-fired Combined Cycle Gas Turbine (CCGT) power station in the UK, West Burton B.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: BECCS at Drax could save UK £4.5bn in meeting fifth carbon budget says report
lead: ​A new report produced by Baringa and commissioned by Drax has found bioenergy with carbon capture and storage (BECCS) could save the UK over £4.5 billion.
author: Alice Grundy

title: ScottishPower’s green hydrogen project looks to build UK’s largest electrolyser
lead: ​ScottishPower has submitted a planning application for the UK’s largest electrolyser as part of the Green Hydrogen for Scotland project.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: Current± Chats: Gore Street's Alex O'Cinneide on the 'critical components' of Dynamic Containment
lead: Current± ​caught up with Alex O'Cinneide, CEO of Gore Street Capital, to talk about the requirements of Dynamic Containment, the value in revenue stacking and the fund's international expansion plans.​
author: Alice Grundy

title: InstaVolt celebrates record-breaking month for charger installs
lead: ​InstaVolt has achieved a record month for electric vehicle (EV) charging installations, with 62 rapid chargers set live in March.
author: Alice Grundy

title: SPEN switches to drone technology for network inspection to drive down emissions
lead: ​SP Energy Networks (SPEN) is switching to drone technology for transmission network inspection, following a successful trial last year.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: Octopus’ Electric Juice Network welcomes NewMotion as European expansion becomes ‘tangible’
lead: ​NewMotion has become the latest to join Octopus Energy’s Electric Juice Network, adding thousands of chargers across the UK and Europe.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: Tesco EV charging rollout hits new milestone with 500,000 charges on network
lead: ​The rollout of electric vehicle (EV) chargers at supermarket Tesco's sites in partnership with Pod Point and Volkswagen has hit a milestone of 500,000 charges.
author: Alice Grundy

title: Centrica partners with Sanctuary to rollout heat pumps in 600 homes
lead: ​Centrica has begun a UK-wide heat pump project together with social landlord Sanctuary Housing.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: Current± Chats: SMS’s Mark Hamilton on managing demand on Orkney and a new route to solar
lead: Current± sat down with SMS MD Mark Hamilton to discuss how FlexiGrid is managing demand in Orkney, what’s next for the ReFLEX project and what Solopower has to offer.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: OVO agrees PPA with Ørsted for Barrow Wind Farm
lead: ​OVO Energy has entered into a power purchase agreement (PPA) with Ørsted to buy green power from its Barrow Offshore Wind Farm.
author: Alice Grundy

title: National Grid ESO fined £1.5m for failing to provide accurate demand forecasts
lead: ​National Grid ESO has agreed to pay £1.5 million to Ofgem’s voluntary redress fund after it failed to provide unbiased and accurate seven-day ahead electricity demand forecasts in 2017.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: Summer Outlook 2021: COVID-19 to continue to damper demand but 'right tools and processes in place'
lead: ​Demand is forecast to continue to be low this summer, although some resurgence is expected in comparison to levels seen in 2020.
author: Alice Grundy

title: ROUND-UP: Good Energy announces new CEO and Limejump expands leadership team
lead: Good Energy announces Nigel Pocklington as its new CEO, while Limejump appoints both a new CTO and COO.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: SSEN incorporates EV chargepoint data into Power Track app
lead: ​Scottish and Southern Electricity Networks (SSEN) is now offering data on electric vehicle (EV) chargepoint availability within its Power Track app.
author: Alice Grundy
